thread.title: Massillon Jackson ends Cincinnati Moeller's undefeated season, 39-38, in Division I championship game
thread.title_full: Massillon Jackson ends Cincinnati Moeller's undefeated season, 39-38, in Division I championship game

author: Tim Bielik, cleveland.com
title: Massillon Jackson ends Cincinnati Moeller's undefeated season, 39-38, in Division I championship game
text:
More News | More Photos | More Videos 
COLUMBUS, Ohio â€” Massillon Jackson's Kyle Young split a 1-and-1 free throw with 3.6 seconds remaining, and Cincinnati Moeller's last chance missed giving the Polar Bears the Division I state championship, 39-38, on Saturday at the Schottenstein Center. 
The win gives Massillon Jackson its second state title in school history. The first came in 2010, and both have come against Moeller. 
Young, a Butler commit, was fouled driving into the lane by Moeller's Caleb Canter with 3.6 seconds remaining. He only had five points, but grabbed 10 rebounds for Massillon Jackson (28-2). 
Logan Hill had 12 points to lead the Polar Bears, and Jaret Pallotta had 11 points and seven rebounds. 
The Crusaders (28-1) entered the game as the last remaining unbeaten in the state of Ohio and tried to be the first Division I team to go undefeated since Zanesville in 1995. 
Moeller's Miles McBride had a game-high 15 points and grabbed nine rebounds. Keegan McDowell added 14 points and eight rebounds. 
Both teams shot 13-for-37 from the floor.
